Activity â€“ Identify DSL Terminology
Drag each DSL term to the appropriate definition.
You have successfully matched each DSL term to its definition.
You have not successfully matched each DSL term to its definition. Please click Reset to try again.
One end connects to a telephone device and the other end connects to the telephone wall jack.
This category of DSL technology provides equal high-speed downstream and upstream data capacities.
Located at the CO, this device combines individual DSL connections from subscribers into one high-capacity link to an ISP.
This category of DSL technology provides high-speed downstream data capacity value with a lower upstream capacity value.
A means of providing high-speed connections over pre-existing installed copper wire infrastructure.
Sometimes referred to as the DSL modem, it connects the subscriber to the DSL network.
